description.narrative: PARC will be ensuring safe water availability and accessibility for families evacuated during the recent violence in Gaza who are now living in open spaces and informal gatherings. 1) Distribution of 290 water tanks (capacity 275 cubic metre) in 40 safe, public places 2) Distribution of 500 plastic containers (capacity 20 litres) for families to transport water to their houses - Beneficiaries will be selected based on number of family members, children, elderly, and assistance from other NGOs 3) Provision of safe drinking water - through contracting water company running desalination plants - continually for 7 days until further arrangements are made with municipalities and other NGOs (e.g. Oxfam GB) The tanks are planned to be installed at rural women centres and clubs located at : Alshoka, Almanara, Beit lahia, Al sawalha’a, Wadi al-Salaqa, 2) Youth centers : Jabliya, Deir Alballah, Khanyounis, 3) CBOs (Women /men groups): Alnasir, Alfukhari, Beit lahia, West Rafah, Beit Hanoon, Jabaliya, Deir Alballah, Alnisarat, Wadi Alsalqa, Alnassir, Khirbit Aladas

The project will bring about significant change to the lives of people living in Gaza who have been affected by the recent conflict. The provision of safe drinking water for a continual 7 day period will enable at least 20,000 people access water safely for no cost. The water tanks will be filled twice a day, providing 20 litres per person per day. Once funding from CA ended, PARC coordinated with other agencies (e.g. ANERA, Oxfam) for the provision of water using the equipment provided by CA to reach a total of 111,400 people.
